text: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover.
author: Mark Twain

text: I can't understand why people are frightened of new ideas. I'm frightened of the old ones.
author: John Cage

text: The tragedy of life is not so much what men suffer, but rather what they miss.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

text: It's better to hang out with people better than you. Pick out associates whose behavior is better than yours and you'll drift in that direction.
author: Warren Buffett

text: The question is not who is going to let me, it's who is going to stop me.
author: Ayn Rand

text: The dumbest people I know are those who know it all.
author: Malcolm Forbes

text: If what you’re doing is not your passion, you have nothing to lose.
author: George Eliot

text: The person who says something is impossible should not interrupt the person who is doing it.
Making the simple complicated is commonplace; making the complicated simple, awesomely simple, that's creativity.
author: Charles Mingus

text: All our dreams can come true – if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Walt Disney

text: The best years of your life are the ones in which you decide your problems are your own. You do not blame them on your mother, the ecology, or the president. You realize that you control your own destiny.
author: Albert Ellis

text: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.
author: Milton Berle

text: Let us so live that when we come to die even the undertaker will be sorry.
author: Mark Twain

text: A good traveler has no fixed plans, and is not intent on arriving.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The World is a book, and those who do not travel read only a page.
author: Saint Augustine

text: Once in a while it really hits people that they don't have to experience the world in the way they have been told to.
author: Alan Keightley

text: The important thing is not being afraid to take a chance. Remember, the greatest failure is to not try. Once you find something you love to do, be the best at doing it.
author: Debbi Fields

text: Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Yesterday is history. Tomorrow is a mystery. Today is a gift. That's why we call it 'The Present'.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.
author: Mark Twain

text: Money alone isn't enough to bring happiness . . . happiness [is] when you're actually truly ok with losing everything you have.
author: Tony Hsieh

text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that’s all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Don't wait. The time will never be just right.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: A year from now you may wish you had started today.
author: Karen Lamb

text: Live simply, so others may simply live.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

text: We act as though comfort and luxury were the chief requirements of life, when all that we need to make us happy is something to be enthusiastic about.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The key to performance is elegance, not battalions of special cases.
author: Jon Bentley and Douglas McIlroy

text: A desk is a dangerous place from which to view the world.
author: John Le Carre

text: One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Folks who never do any more than they are paid for, never get paid more than they do.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: The trouble in corporate America is that too many people with too much power live in a box (their home), then travel the same road every day to another box (their office).
author: Faith Popcorn

text: We buy things we don't need with money we don't have to impress people we don't like.
author: David Ramsey

text: It is hard to fail, but it is worse never to have tried to succeed.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Instead of wondering when your next vacation is, maybe you should set up a life you don't need to escape from.
author: Seth Godin

text: It’s a funny thing about life; if you refuse to accept anything but the best, you very often get it.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

text: We make a fine bourbon, at a profit if we can, at a loss if we must, but always FINE BOURBON.
author: Pappy Van Winkle

text: An army of lions led by a sheep is no match for an army of sheep led by a lion.
author: Winston Churchill

text: A ship in port is safe, but that is not what ships are for.
author: Grace Hopper

text: I never let my schooling get in the way of my education
author: Mark Twain

text: There are no traffic jams along the extra mile.
author: Roger Staubach

text: The world is a dangerous place, not because of those who do evil, but because of those who look on and do nothing.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Whatever you think you can do or believe you can do, begin it. Action has magic, grace and power in it.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Defeat is not the worst of failures.  Not to have tried is the true failure.
author: George Woodberry

text: It is always the start that requires the greatest effort.
author: James Cash Penney

text: The best thinking has been done in solitude.
author: Thomas Edison

text: If you will live like no one else, later you can live like no one else.
author: Dave Ramsey

text: The harder I work, the luckier I get.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

text: Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Never regret. If it's good, it's wonderful. If it's bad, it's experience.
author: Victoria Holt

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then is not an act but a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Don’t make a decision based solely on popularity. Just because other people are doing it doesn’t mean it’s the best choice for you.
author: NULL

text: Sometimes you need to be alone to reflect on life.  Take time out to take care of yourself.  You deserve it.
author: NULL

text: One travels more usefully when alone, because he reflects more.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: We must all suffer one of two things: the pain of discipline or the pain of regret and disappointment.
author: Jim Rohn

text: I haven't failed, I've just found 10,000 ways that don't work.
author: Thomas Alva Edison

text: The three most harmful addictions are heroin, carbohydrates and a monthly salary.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: Never half-ass two things, whole-ass one thing.
author: Ron Swanson

text: Humility is not thinking less of yourself, it's thinking of yourself less.
author: C. S. Lewis

text: Every traveler has a home of his own, and he learns to appreciate it the more from his wandering.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Study while others are sleeping; work while others are loafing; prepare while others are playing; and dream while others are wishing.
author: William A. Ward

text: Nothing diminishes anxiety faster than action.
author: Walter Anderson

text: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan.
author: Jim Rohn

text: If you can solve your problem, then what is the need of worrying? If you cannot solve it, then what is the use of worrying?
author: Shantideva

text: Sometimes life is going to hit you in the head with a brick. Dont lose faith.
author: Steve Jobs

text: It takes as much energy to wish as it does to plan.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Underpromise;overdeliver.
author: Tom Peters

text: The world needs dreamers and the world needs doers. But above all, the world needs dreamers who do.
author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

text: When you listen, it's amazing what you can learn. When you act on what you've learned, it's amazing what you can change.
author: A. McLaughlin

text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: They may forget what you said, but they will never forget how you made them feel.
author: Carl W. Buechner

text: Be too busy to have time for regrets.
author: Angela Wright

text: Don't spend time with anyone you don't like.
author: Prue Leith

text: Work hard but make sure you enjoy life too.
author: Ted Smart

text: You only get one crack at a big opportunity so make sure you recognize it and grab it with both hands.
author: Darren Richards

text: The more reasons you have for achieving your goal, the more determined you will become.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Nothing is really work unless you would rather be doing something else.
author: James M. Barrie

text: The highest reward for a person's toil is not what they get for it, but what they become by it.
author: John Ruskin

text: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
author: Aristotle

text: Long-range goals keep you from being frustrated by short-term failures.
author: J. C. Penney

text: Respond; don't react. Listen; don't talk. Think; don't assume.
author: Raji Lukkoor

text: Do not fear going forward slowly; fear only to stand still.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Win without boasting. Lose without excuse.
author: Albert Payson

text: Talent is cheaper than table salt. What separates the talented individual from the successful one is a lot of hard work.
author: Stephen King

text: Don't re-open old wounds in order to examine their origins. Leave them healed.
author: Richard Bandler

text: The act of taking the first step is what separates the winners from the losers.
author: Brian Tracy

text: A goal should scare you a little, and excite you a lot.
author: Dr. Joe Vitale

text: A person who won't read has no advantage over one who can't read.
author: Mark Twain

text: It always seems impossible until it's done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.
author: Christopher Morley

text: Always and never are two words you should always remember never to use.
author: Wendell Johnson

text: Don't find fault, find a remedy.
author: Henry Ford

text: A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and goes to bed at night and in between does what he wants to do.
author: Bob Dylan

text: A superior man is modest in his speech, but exceeds in his actions.
author: Confucious

text: You cannot do a kindness too soon, for you never know how soon it will be too late.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
